name: tablr
description: Edit CSV files using a table editor

tablr-models.description: Expose Tablr models to other Atom packages

undefinedDisplay.title: Undefined Value Display
undefinedDisplay.description: How to render undefined values in a cell. Leave the field blank to display an empty cell.

pageMoveRowAmount.title: Page Move Row Amount
pageMoveRowAmount.description: The number of rows to jump when using the `core:page-up` and `core:page-down` commands.

pageMoveColumnAmount.title: Page Move Column Amount
pageMoveColumnAmount.description: The number of columns to jump when using the `tablr:page-left` and `tablr:page-right` commands.

scrollSpeedDuringDrag.title: Scroll Speed During Drag
scrollSpeedDuringDrag.description: The speed of the scrolling motion during a drag gesture, in pixels.

scrollPastEnd.title: Scroll Past End
scrollPastEnd.description: When enabled, the table can scroll past the end of the table both vertically and horizontally to let manipulate rows and columns more easily.

rowHeight.title: Row Height
rowHeight.description: The default row height in pixels.

rowOverdraw.description: The number of rows to render outside the bounds of the visible area to smooth the scrolling motion.
rowOverdraw.title: Row Overdraw

minimumRowHeight.title: Minimum Row Height
minimumRowHeight.description: The minimum height of a row in pixels.

rowHeightIncrement.title: Row Height Increment
rowHeightIncrement.description: The amount of pixels to add or remove to a row when using the row resizing commands.

columnWidth.title: Column Width
columnWidth.description: The default column width in pixels.

columnOverdraw.title: Column Overdraw
columnOverdraw.description: The number of columns to render outside the bounds of the visible area to smooth the scrolling motion.

minimumColumnWidth.title: Minimum Column Width
minimumColumnWidth.description: The minimum column width in pixels.

columnWidthIncrement.title: Column Width Increment
columnWidthIncrement.description: The amount of pixels to add or remove to a column when using the column resizing commands.

flattenBufferMultiSelectionOnPaste.title: Flatten Buffer Multi Selection On Paste
flattenBufferMultiSelectionOnPaste.description: If the clipboard content comes from a multiple selection copy in a text editor, the whole clipboard text will be pasted in each cell of the table selection.

distributeBufferMultiSelectionOnPaste.title: Distribute Buffer Multi Selection On Paste
distributeBufferMultiSelectionOnPaste.description: If the clipboard content comes from a multiple selection copy in a text editor, each selection will be considered as part of the same column (`vertically`) or of the same row (`horizontally`).

treatEachCellAsASelectionWhenPastingToAB.title: Treat Each Cell As A Selection When Pasting To A Buffer
treatEachCellAsASelectionWhenPastingToAB.description: When copying from a table to paste the content in a text editor this setting will make each cell appear as if they were created from different selections.

maximumRowsInPreview.description: The maximum number of rows in the CSV preview. Low numbers can speed up the preview generation but can also lead to error or inconsistencies when parsing the whole file if there is errors past the last row in the preview.

tableCreationBatchSize.description: When creating a table from a CSV file, filling the table in one single loop can lock the UI if the table is too large. To prevent that from happening the table is filled in small steps where a number of rows equals to the batch size are added to the table.

columnDelimiter.title: Default Column Delimiter
columnDelimiter.description: The default column delimiter to use when opening a CSV for the first time. You can write space characters code such as `\t` instead of using the proper character.

rowDelimiter.title: Default Row Delimiter
rowDelimiter.description: The default row delimiter to use when opening a CSV for the first time. You can write space characters code such as `\r` instead of using the proper character. The `auto` value will let the CSV parser determine the proper separator to use depending on the file's content.

quote.title: Default Quote Character
quote.description: The default quote character for quoted content.

escape.title: Default Escape Character
escape.description: The default escape character for escaped quotes in quoted content.

comment.title: Default Comment Character
comment.description: The default character that indicate a comment. Everything past this character in a line will be ignored. You can set it to `none` to disable the use of comments.

quoted.title: Quoted Content
quoted.description: Whether the column's content are wrapped into quotes or not.

header.title: File Header
header.description: Whether to treat the first line of a CSV as the file header or not.

eof.title: Ensure New Line At End Of File
eof.description: When checked, every file will be saved with an extra new-line character at the end of the file.

skipEmptyLines.title: Skip Empty Lines
skipEmptyLines.description: When checked, empty lines will simply be ignored.

trim.title: Trim Cell Content
trim.description: How to treat cell's content when parsing a CSV file.

encoding.title: Default Encoding
encoding.description: The default encoding to use when opening a new CSV file.

supportedCsvExtensions.description: The extensions for which the CSV opener will be used.

disablePreview.title: Disable preview
disablePreview.description: When checked, preview will not be presented.

defaultColumnNamingMethod.description: When file has no header, select the default naming method for the columns. `alphabetic` means use A, B,…, Z, AA, AB… `numeric` is for simple numbers, ie 1, 2… `numericZeroBased` is similar to `numeric`, except that it starts numbering from 0 instead of 1
